alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 9:09AM EDT until May 27 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cumberland County in central Virginia... Prince Edward County in central Virginia... Northwestern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... West central Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 908 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Red House to Cullen to Drakes Branch, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Darlington Heights around 920 AM EDT. Hampden Sydney and Prospect around 930 AM EDT. Farmville, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University and Green Bay around 935 AM EDT. Rice around 945 AM EDT. Guinea Mills around 950 AM EDT. Cumberland around 1000 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Briery, Oak Forest, Twin Lakes State Park, Hawk, Kingsville and Elam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward
